copy.content_text:
This is an example page. It’s different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I’m a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin’ caught in the rain.)

…or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

copy.content_text:
SMARTER HOG TRAPPING

BUY NOW

Introducing the HogEye Mini Camera

NEW HogEye Mini Camera System

The next generation of HogEye is here. Built from the ground up for landowners and trappers, the new HogEye Mini Camera delivers the same trusted reliability you’ve come to expect – now in a smaller, smarter, and more affordable package. After decades of trapping experience and years of listening to customers, we designed a system that eliminates DIY headaches and puts professional-grade trapping technology within reach for everyone.

The New HogEye Mini Camera

Compact & Lightweight – 75% smaller design makes it easier to mount and move.

Longer Battery Life – 60% less power means you get a compact battery and small solar panel.

Wider Field of View – See more of your trap site, inside and out.

Built to Last – Backed by a 3-year bumper-to-bumper warranty and U.S.-based support team.

Custom HogEye App – Trapping-specific features with full control at your fingertips.

Flexible Data Plans – Start or stop service anytime – no contracts, no fees.

Affordable Price Point – Professional trapping technology now within reach for everyone.

With the new HogEye Camera, you don’t just get a smaller box – you get smarter trapping from start to finish.

BUY NOW

3-Year Total Replacement Warranty

Bumper to Bumper

If it breaks, you give us a call, send it back, and we’ll replace it.

Why Hogeye Camera Systems?

Real-Time Remote Triggering

Trigger your trap from anywhere. Our camera system gives you full control in real-time – no more guessing or wasted effort.

Proven Results in the Field

Used by ranchers, farmers, and land managers worldwide to eliminate feral hog populations with precision.

No Power? No Problem.

Our systems are built for off-grid reliability and ease of setup in any environment.

Full Visibility, Day or Night

High-definition camera feeds with night vision gives you the clarity you need – around the clock.

BUY NOW

Who Uses Hogeye?

Cattle Ranchers

Farmers

State Wildlife and Conservation Departments

Hunters

Timberland Managers

If you have a hog problem, we can help!

Trusted Referrals From Your Neighbors

Jimmy Riley

Giles Island

I’ve been on Giles Island for 25 years. For the first 18 years, we didn’t have any hogs here, but we started seeing a lot of hogs. That’s when we started to use HogEye. Since then we have caught every hog on this 9400 acres island.

Rodney Johnson

Johnson Timber Company, Clay County, MS

Before Hogeye we had been fighting and loosing the battle against the pigs for 20 years. Hogeye gave us the control we needed to take back our land, and over the last 10 years we have used our cameras to catch over 2000 hogs. Thanks to Hogeye we have very few hogs left and my family and I can enjoy our property free of the problems we once had!

Jody Acosta

Delta Wildlife

“I’ve used many different types of cameras assisting private landowners with trapping all across the Mississippi Delta. I can say without a doubt, HogEye is the best on the market.“

BUY NOW

Old School Still Works

Are you using a previous generation camera? No problem.

We still offer replacement parts and services – to keep you up and running for years to come!

Get Legacy Parts

Let’s work together

If you have a unique hog trapping challenge, we can help. We combine the expertise of our leadership team with the premier traps and camera systems for your needs.

Ready to Take Back Your Land?

Don’t wait until your land is destroyed. Hogeye makes it easy to trap hogs fast.

BUY NOW

title: Hog Trap Camera | Remote Cage Monitoring – HogEye

copy.content_text:
High-Tech Eyes for an Old-School Trap

Trap Cameras for Steel Traps

Wild hogs may be smart – but you’re smarter.

Hogeye’s trap cameras turn any standard trap into a smarter, more effective hog control system

BUY NOW

HogEye Camera: Real-Time Monitoring. Remote Triggering. Better Results.

Whether you’re protecting crops, pasture, recreational, or hunting land, knowing when to close the trap is critical. Having a HogEye camera gives you more control.

The HogEye Camera System lets you be in charge of when to make the catch- with the press of a button – no matter where you are.

Step 1

Pre-bait and set up your camera.

Step 2

Set up your Trap and Keep it Baited.

Step 3

Watch live video from your phone, tablet, or computer – day or night, then trigger the trap remotely.

BUY NOW

Key Features of our Trap Camera

Instant Motion Alerts

Get real-time notifications when hogs enter the trap zone.

Live Streaming – Day or Night

See exactly what’s happening – even in total darkness.

One-Touch Remote Triggering

Set the trap from your phone, exactly when you want to.

Easy Setup

Mounts easily near any trap. All power components are included.

Durable in All Conditions

Rugged enough for rough weather, dust, and heat – built for the field.

3-Year Total Replacement Warranty

Bumper to Bumper

If it breaks, you give us a call, send it back, and we’ll replace it.

A Camera That Works with All Standard Traps

Already have traps on your property? No problem. Hogeye cameras are designed to work with most existing setups.
Need help with installation or system configuration? We’re here for that too. Just call us at 855-494-3935.

BUY NOW

Frequently Asked Questions About Using the HogEye Camera

Can I monitor multiple traps from the same account?

Yes! The HogEye App, you can monitor multiple traps at the same time on one dashboard.

Does it work without cell service?

The Hogeye system requires signal – we’ll help you choose the right setup for your location.

How do I mount the camera?

Easy-to-use mounts are included with every system. Setup takes minutes.

Can multiple people monitor my trap with the HogEye Camera?

YES! The HogEye App allows you to give permission to unlimited users for no additional fees. Everyone can watch the trap and trigger when you’re ready to catch.

All HogEye Information Resources

BUY NOW

Have questions about the HogEye and your trap?

Call 855-464-3935

Big Pig Traps

Check out the Big Pig Traps that Pair Perfectly with the HogEye Camera System

With over 25 years of experience in wildlife, forestry, and natural resource management, we’ve seen firsthand the extensive damage wild hogs inflict on farms, forests, and recreational lands-costing billions. Big Pig Traps and HogEye Cameras were created from this deep knowledge, shaped by the input of landowners just like you.

Controlling wild hogs makes you a steward of the land, protecting your property and preserving the ecosystem for future generations

Trusted Referrals From Your Neighbors

Jimmy Riley

Giles Island

I’ve been on Giles Island for 25 years. For the first 18 years, we didn’t have any hogs here, but we started seeing a lot of hogs. That’s when we started to use HogEye. Since then we have caught every hog on this 9400 acres island.

Rodney Johnson

Johnson Timber Company, Clay County, MS

Before Hogeye we had been fighting and loosing the battle against the pigs for 20 years. Hogeye gave us the control we needed to take back our land, and over the last 10 years we have used our cameras to catch over 2000 hogs. Thanks to Hogeye we have very few hogs left and my family and I can enjoy our property free of the problems we once had!

BUY NOW

title: Net Trap Camera | Remote Hog Trapping – HogEye

copy.content_text:
Smarter Timing. Bigger Catches. Less Work.

Trap Cameras for Net Traps

Net traps are an effective ways to capture entire sounders of hogs.

With HogEye’s Camera System, you’ll know exactly when to release the net – and you can do it from your phone.

BUY NOW

Remote-Controlled Precision for Net Traps

Timing is everything with drop nets and having a net camera makes all the difference.

If you drop too early, you risk only catching a few. Too late, and they’re gone. HogEye’s net camera system solves that.

One well-timed drop = one massive catch. No second chances needed.

Step 1

Pre-bait the hog hotspot area on your land so that you know when and how many hogs are there.

Step 2

Put your net trap up in conditioning mode and continue monitoring with bait. Never let your trap site run out of bait.

Step 3

Use HogEye to go from conditioning to catch phase.

Step 4

Wait for, then capture the hogs.

BUY NOW

HogEye’s Net Camera System

24/7 Live Video Feed

Watch real-time video in daylight or darkness to confirm hog count before dropping.

Remote Net Deployment

Drop the net from anywhere – no need to sit and wait.

Wide-Angle View for Maximum Visibility

See the entire drop area clearly to ensure you’re getting the full sounder.

Battery & Solar Powered

Designed for remote field use.

Fast, Simple Setup

Integrates easily into existing net trap systems.

Why Use HogEye for Net Traps?

Maximize Your Catch

Control when your net is set and ready.
Reduce Human Disturbance

Stay far from the trap site and avoid alerting the hogs.
Use Fewer Resources

Fewer trips. Fewer mistakes. More effective trapping.

BUY NOW

Frequently Asked Questions About Using the HogEye Camera

How do I mount the camera above the net?

Most users mount to a longer t-post or pole.

Can I reuse the camera on other traps?

Yes! HogEye is fully adaptable –use it with nets, panel traps, drop trap, or custom traps.

How high should the latch/trigger be above the ground to hold the net in conditioning mode?

We recommend mounting the latch ~7-10 feet above the ground. 9-10 feet allows for full clearance so the pigs can walk under with no interference, while lowering it down to 7-8 feet allows the pigs to brush their back up against the net to get used to the feel of having to walk or push under it. Starting with the latch at 10ft allows you to work your way down during conditioning if desired.

What do you use to get the trigger 7-10 feet above the ground?

You can use an 10-12ft t-post

Use two 6-7ft t-posts (a much more common size). Drive the first post into the center of the trap and simply use zip-ties to attach the second post onto the first to extend it.

You can use a heavy metal stake or small diameter pipe and drive it into the center of the trap, then simply slide a larger diameter pipe over it. This can make it easier to set the trigger without something to stand on.

Should I use a cellular camera on my trap?

Yes, we highly recommend you use a cellular camera on your trap to send you real-time notifications if the pigs enter. While the trap is extremely durable, the trap is meant as a containment unit to hold the pigs secure until you can arrive to usher them on to their fate or destination, not a holding pen. While extremely tough and durable, leaving the pigs in the trap for longer periods can lead to behavior that is not conducive to the long term health of your trap. We recommend getting the pigs taken care of as soon as possible.

Should you use the camera to drop/trigger the net over pigs or just to set the trap?

Both! The most common, and convenient use for using a Hogeye on your trap is to remotely set it into catch mode after the pigs have been conditioned. This will save you the time and hassle of having to go out and set it, as well as minimize disturbance the day or night you hope to catch. You can also use the Hogeye to hold up one side of the trap to trigger it after the hog(s) enter. This is very useful in cases of trap shy or “bully” pigs that are by themselves or very educated and not interested in pushing under the net to catch themselves. This is also a good tool to have if you’re dealing with a high presence of non-target animals such as deer, i.e. you don’t have to trigger it until the pigs show up! Once one or more are caught, the continuous catch nature of the trap will allow the rest of them to enter.

How or where should I mount the camera when using it on a net trap?

We recommend mounting the camera ~8-10ft in the air directly next to the trap (drive a post and secure another post or pole to it to mount the camera on). Once mounted, the camera can be angled down for a birds-eye view so you can see 100% of the trap as well as the area surrounding it. Mounting the camera high also eliminates glare that can be caused by the IR light if you were to attempt to mount it low to look through the trap vs look down into it from above.

Should I mount the camera on a post that the trap is set up with, or use a separate pole?

While you can mount your camera on a trap t-post, we recommend using a separate pole or post that is not attached to the trap. When the pigs become unhappy with their situation inside the trap, they will begin running around which causes the trap and posts to shake and bounce. If your camera is mounted on one of these poles it will endure unnecessary abuse, so we recommend against it.

All HogEye Information Resources

BUY NOW

Check out the Boar Blanket Net Traps that Pair Perfectly with the HogEye Camera System

With over 25 years of experience in wildlife, forestry, and natural resource management, we’ve seen firsthand the extensive damage wild hogs inflict on farms, forests, and recreational lands-costing billions. Boar Blanket and HogEye Cameras were created from this deep knowledge, shaped by the input of landowners just like you.

Controlling wild hogs makes you a steward of the land, protecting your property and preserving the ecosystem for future generations

Boar Blanket Traps

Trusted Referrals From Your Neighbors

Bryan Ferick, Beavers Unlimited

“We coupled the Boar Blanket with the Hogeye system and trigger. GAME CHANGER! I trap one property that is 130 miles round-trip from my house. The ability to drop the net to “set” it without burning that extra gas has definitely increased my productivity and profit.”

BUY NOW

questions.answer: Yes! HogEye is fully adaptable --use it with nets, panel traps, drop trap, or custom traps.

faqs.question: How do I mount the HogEye camera above the net trap?
faqs.answer: Most users mount the HogEye camera to a longer t-post or pole to effectively observe the trap area.

faqs.question: Can the HogEye camera system be reused on different traps?
faqs.answer: Yes, HogEye's camera system is fully adaptable and can be used with nets, panel traps, drop traps, or custom traps.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of using HogEye's net camera system for trapping wild hogs?
faqs.answer: HogEye's net camera system allows you to monitor real-time footage day and night, deploy the net remotely from anywhere, ensure maximum visibility with a wide-angle view, operate independently without external power, and set up quickly—making trapping more efficient and less disruptive.

faqs.question: How does the HogEye system help in controlling hog populations effectively?
faqs.answer: The system maximizes your catch by controlling precisely when the net is set, reduces human disturbance by allowing remote management, and lowers resource usage by minimizing trips and mistakes.

faqs.question: What additional products are recommended for use along with the HogEye camera system?
faqs.answer: Boar Blanket net traps are recommended as they pair perfectly with the HogEye camera system, offering a comprehensive solution that combines effective trapping with monitoring technology.

Shop Legacy Camera Parts Here

Legacy Camera Parts

Frequently Asked Questions – HogEye Camera System

What kind of battery should I get?

The HogEye Mini comes with a 50amh lithium battery and solar panel.

How does the Organization work?

Each “Organization” represents the subscriber’s Group of Users. Users can be a part of multiple “Organizations.” There are 3 tiers for an organization:

• The Owner has complete control of the organization and all cameras

• An Admin can do everything EXCEPT change billing information.

• A Member can only stream the camera and download videos

How do I cut back on notifications?

If you go to the camera view screen, you will see a gear icon. If you press this, it will bring you to the camera configuration page, and you will be able to adjust the white outline, which represents the motion box. Adjust the box specifically around the area you want to monitor and click SAVE. You can also increase or decrease the sensitivity of your camera on the same page.

How many users can I have?

Currently there is No limit on the number of users in an organization.

How do I update my subscription/credit card?

Go to the online portal and log in https://signup.hogeyecameras.com Click on the “Subscription” tab and you will see the option to cancel or add a different payment method. If you add a different payment method, you will need to select it and UPDATE the subscription.

How long will a battery last?

a. A fully charged battery with no solar with last on average 5-6 days

b. A battery with solar charging will last several months at a minimum, assuming the correct battery is used and you have direct sun on the panel.

How much sunlight does my solar panel need and how to position it?

A minimum of 3 hours of direct sunlight is required to maintain the battery at the proper charge. The more horizontal the better when positioning the solar panel.

What to do before contacting customer support.

Attempt to collect as much information as possible prior to contacting support. Camera # and e-mail address of the primary account Owner. Please make a note of which lights are on/off (Power, Signal, and Carrier).

Why is my camera “inactive”

An inactive camera doesn’t always mean it is down. An inactive camera simply means it did not check-in at the correct time. Attempt to stream the camera first to verify that it is truly not active. Inactive cameras are most often power related. Wait 20-minutes and try again. If it isn’t working, give us a call at 855-464-3935 x2

How do I get in touch with customer support?

a. Phone: 855-464-3935 x2

b. Email: support@wildlifedominion.com

NEW HogEye Mini Camera System Compare to the Legacy HogEye Camera?

Feature

NEW HogEye Camera

Legacy HogEye Camera

Price

$1,299 for camera- makes the HogEye Mini accessible to more land owners

No longer available for sale. However Legacy HogEye Owners still have full support and replacement equipment available.

Size & Setup

Compact and lightweight – 75% smaller and easier to mount anywhere.

Larger and heavier, requires more setup space.

Warranty & Support

3 year “Bumper to Bumper warranty with US Based support from real trappers and technical experts.

4-limited warranty. Legacy Cameras are still fully supported.

Battery Life

Battery is included and is half the size of a traditional battery. Smaller solar panel is also included.

Bigger battery and solar panel. Battery was not included with the Legacy HogEye.

Control

Same digital pan, tilt, and zoom features that you can adjust.

Digital pan, tilt, and zoom features let’s you adjust exactly what you see.

Technology

Camera Technology and App are made in the USA and have features designed specifically for trapping.

Camera Technology and App are made in the USA and have features designed specifically for trapping.

Flexibility

Works with any trap (commercial or homemade)

Works with any trap (commercial or homemade)

Data Plans

$49.99/mo. on AT&T or Verizon Wireless. Start/Stop anytime -no contracts or fees

$65/mo. on AT&T or Verzion. Start/Stop at anytime-no contracts or fees

View & Coverage

Wider field of view lets you see inside and outside the trap

Smaller coverage area

BUY NOW

Trusted Referrals From Your Neighbors

Jimmy Riley

Giles Island

I’ve been on Giles Island for 25 years. For the first 18 years, we didn’t have any hogs here, but we started seeing a lot of hogs. That’s when we started to use HogEye. Since then we have caught every hog on this 9400 acres island.

Rodney Johnson

Johnson Timber Company, Clay County, MS

Before Hogeye we had been fighting and loosing the battle against the pigs for 20 years. Hogeye gave us the control we needed to take back our land, and over the last 10 years we have used our cameras to catch over 2000 hogs. Thanks to Hogeye we have very few hogs left and my family and I can enjoy our property free of the problems we once had!

Jody Acosta

Delta Wildlife

“I’ve used many different types of cameras assisting private landowners with trapping all across the Mississippi Delta. I can say without a doubt, HogEye is the best on the market.“

BUY NOW

questions.question: What kind of battery should I get?
questions.answer: A true 12V Marine Deep Cycle Group 29+ but here are a few we recommend. Hybrid (Dual Purpose) batteries that are commonly sold are NOT suitable for use with the HogEye camera system. Please reference the following batteries at leading retailers: a. Walmart: Everstart Maxx Lead Acid 29DC b. Interstate Batteries: Marine/RV Battery (DC29) c. Interstate Batteries: SRM-31 Deep Cycle d. NAPA: NAPA 8000 Series Battery BCI No. 31 650 A

copy.content_text:
Terms & Conditions

Terms and Conditions

Thank you for choosing Wildlife Dominion Management LLC (“WDM”) and/or one of our partner companies and products. Carefully read these Terms of Use (“Terms”) so you will understand how our sites and platforms operate (“sites”), what we offer, and how we can work together. Please also read our Privacy Policy. Using WDM sites and platforms, constitutes the user agreeing to the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy at the time of you visit. If you choose not to agree to the Terms and Conditions and/or the Privacy Policy, you must refrain from using any of the WDM sites and platforms. WDM sites and platforms are only available to users who can form legally binding contracts/agreements with Wildlife Dominion Management LLC including affiliates and partner companies. These “Terms and Conditions” are in conjuncture with the “Privacy Policy” of WDM and the user must submit to both documents.

About Us

WDM offers Web Portal(s) and associated Mobile Applications, which are used to receive notifications, view snap shots, view live video, review recorded videos, and potentially operate a Third-Party device(s).

Our Customers

The “site” is open to anyone; however, services are only available to registered user (“User”). Visiting the site, even without registering, WDM will consider you a “user”.

Responsibilities of User(s)

The information you provided WDM is true and accurate to your ability when you register to become a user.

User has/have given a valid email address, WDM may choose to confirm upon registration, or any time thereafter, via a conformation email which may require an action/response to complete registration or remain “active”.

User will notify WDM if something within this information changes.

User will/is not breaking any applicable laws when using WDM products, services, and platforms.

User will not violate any of these “Terms” as a User.

If you so choose to become a User, you are responsible for the content and activities of their account. Protecting their information and property and sites of WDM with a secure password, and not sharing passwords is the responsibility of the User. WDM recommends using passwords with a combination of numbers, symbols, and upper- and lower-case letters to create a secure login.

WDM reserves the right to terminate user access at any time (even if a payment is current or prepaid), without warning for any or no reason, with or without prior notice of explanation without liability, and can seek legal actions if deemed necessary. Users who infringe the intellectual property rights of others, including WDM property will be terminated and are subject to legal action(s). Additionally, users who commit illegal acts using WDM products, sites, or platforms can/may have their accounts terminated, suspended, restricted, or denied access. Users will be held responsible for any and all damages to WDM or others from activities deemed illegal or to violate these Terms.

Pricing and Service Plans

Users can visit and register on a WDM site with no cost.

Users will incur a monthly cost as a paying “owner” of an organization.

Said cost cover access to mobile data and service to applicable platforms and apps.

Data/Service plans will start on the same date as original purchase for the life of the membership, and are automated monthly purchases. Suspension of services and subsequent reactivation could change said date.

Suspension of data/service fees can be achieved through the signup portals of the corresponding product site and is the responsibility of the user. Users requesting suspension of data/service via email or other messaging can not be guaranteed as verification of identity is required.

Content and Data Limits

Users who are paid organization owners are allowed nearly unlimited viewing with their monthly subscription; however, downloading videos will consume larger amounts of data and can/will consume your monthly data allowance. The amount of data is regulated by WDM and products and services have specific data triggers to prevent excessive data consumption. WDM can/will store snapshot, notification, and video archives for a period of 2 weeks before said items are no longer available. It is the responsibility of the user to retrieve said data if desired. Monthly data/service fees are for a period of 30 days. WDM is not responsible for failed transactions for reoccurring data/service fees.

Content Privacy

Users retain the rights to any content they submit, upload or display on any WDM site, product, or platform. WDM its partners and affiliates, reserve the right to use content for process such as marketing, product research, and advertising. WDM its partners and affiliates will make reasonable efforts to protect the privacy of its users, and its data. Users are responsible for any activity deemed illegal by governing agencies or organizations and judicial officials.

User content is considered private and not visible to other users or the public Internet.

It is considered a misuse by WDM to provide user credentials publicly and doing so may result in termination of your account and removal of your content.

Providing direct links to WDM sites or your content is prohibited.

Users allowing your camera to upload content (photos and videos), users are confirming that content is their property, and the uploading and use of content does not violate the privacy rights, publicity rights, copyrights, contract rights, intellectual property rights, or human rights of someone else. WDM has the right to remove any and all content, if it is deemed that you are violating any of these rights. User is responsible for any and all costs associated with these infringements.

WDM may moderate and use content as stated above. However, WDM is not responsible for content you upload and are/is under no obligation to modify or remove any inappropriate content.

Users who choose to suspend or allow their account to go inactive, WDM is under no obligation to keep or store their content beyond the termination of said data/service time.

WDM owns, leases, and licenses the software to create the website, apps, and platforms; these are property of WDM and may not be copied, publicly displayed, reproduced, or be recreated.

WDM Webmasters and IT technicians reserve the right to investigate issues and/or problems during the course of normal business operations. This may allow your content and privacy to become visible to WDM and third-party partners. WDM will take every precaution to maintain your privacy and content during these processes.

Important Guidelines

Terms and the Privacy Policy can change, WDM may announce any “large” changes, however your use of the products, websites, apps, and platforms after the change, regardless of user being aware of the changes does constitute user agreement to the changes.

WDM is a US based company and user usage in “other” countries may offer you fewer protections and rights.

Downloading of software, using the websites, apps, products, and platforms is the sole risk of the user.

WDM and these Terms are governed by, and interpreted in keeping with, the laws of the State of Mississippi. Users agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located within the State of Mississippi to resolve any dispute that may arise. Users herby knowingly, voluntarily and intentionally waive any right it may have to a trial by jury in respect of any litigation (including but not limited to any claims, counterclaims, cross-claims, or third-party claims) arising out of, under or in connection with the term and agreement policy. Further, each party hereto certifies that no representative or agent of either party has represented, expressly or otherwise, that such party would not in the event of such litigation, seek to enforce this waiver of right to jury trial provision. Each of the parties acknowledges that this section is a material inducement for the other party entering into this agreement. User further agrees to arbitration at their expense, to attempt settlement of any issues, prior to any legal filings.

Users acknowledge the use of the “sites” is at their own risk and the services are provided “AS IS”.

WDM is not implying the “sites” will meet any of your specific needs or that you will obtain particular results if using said “sites”.

WDM encourages the user to save content independently of WDM “sites”. WDM is not responsible if content is deleted, modified, suspended, or discontinued due to a malfunction or disruption in services.

WDM will make effort to keep the “sites” up and running and accessible at all times. WDM is not responsible for any errors, omissions, interruptions, deletions, defects, delays in operation or transmissions, communications failures, theft or destruction or unauthorized access to, or alteration of, any user communication. This includes but not limited to; results of maintenance of “sites” or any problems or malfunctions of any network, servers, software, equipment, internet traffic, or any other failure of any nature.

WDM is not responsible for advertisements or applications or services that are/may be posted on our “sites”. Nor does WDM have any responsibility for the goods and services provided by advertisers, third-party or via the websites or applications including our vendors.

WDM evaluates data usage and provides actual data amount per billing cycles via independent cellular and satellite wireless carriers. Actual data usage will vary based on network conditions including capacity and coverage of data providers. Users should be aware that firmware updates to their camera can be done via cellular and satellite networks and can affect data allowances.

WDM Limitation of Liability

These Terms and our Privacy Policy are binding contract and the user needs to acknowledge the following.

LIMITATION ON LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL WDM BE LIABLE TO THE USER OR ANY THIRD-PARTY FOR ANY INDEIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFIT DAMAGES ARISING FROM USE OF THE WDM “SITES” AND SERVICES, EVEN IF WDM HAD BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. NOT WITH STANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY CONTAINED HEREIN, WDM’S LIABILITY TO THE USER FOR ANY CAUSE WHATSOEVER AND REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF THE ACTION, WILL AT ALL TIMES BE LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT PAID, IF ANY, BY THE USER FOR SERVICE FEES DURING THE BILLING CYCLE TERM OF THE MONTH.

User (“Your”) Indemnity to WDM (“Us”). If the user (“you”) breach any of the representation made herein regarding user rights in the content, or your uploading of content violates any of the promises/agreements you have made, you agree to indemnify, defend and hold WDM, its subsidiaries, and affiliates, and their respective officers, agents, partners and employees, harmless from any loss, liability, claim, or demand, including reasonable and all attorneys’ fees, made by any third-party due to or arising out of your use of the “site” and services in violation of that and/or arising from any content that you post on or through the “sites” and services, and through any and all other sites on the internet or in print.

User obligations continue event after you terminate the user agreement and/or services of WDM. Even if the user terminates his/her account and services or WDM terminates user services and membership, user is still held responsible for indemnifying WDM for any breaches that took place while using WDM “sites” and services. Obligations the user owes to WDM, which survive the terminations, will survive under these Terms and Agreements.

GPS Data

GPS data is provided to users with the understanding, there are no guarantees of accuracy and/or reliability. WDM and any affiliates shall not be held liable for any errors or inaccuracies of information received or used through GPS services. GPS information is provided by WDM with implied or expressed purpose of use. Liability for any and all claims or losses resulting from the use of GPS data lies solely with the user.

Audio Recordings

WDM provides audio recordings on some devices. Audio features are not intended for use of surveillance purposes. Audio recording of individuals is strictly covered by laws that are different across the United States and other Countries. WDM products should never be, and are not intended to be, used to record the conversations between two or more people. User is advised that unlawful use of the Audio Recording feature can result in criminal prosecution of the user depending on the state. Punishments for such activities can result in misdemeanor and/or felony charges and punishment can range from fines to imprisonment, depending on the state and country. Information in the document is subject to change without notice and should not be construed as any commitment by Wildlife Dominion Management LLC, including any affiliates and partners. WDM further assumes no responsibility for errors that may appear in this document. Wildlife Dominion Management LLC, including any affiliates and partners shall in NO event be liable for incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of WDM products, websites, apps, and platforms (“sites”) described but not limited to this document/agreement.

title: Copy of Hog Trap Camera Resources | HogEye Setup Guide

copy.content_text:
Resources for your Camera System

Let’s Get Your HogEye Camera System Setup!

Video Demonstrations

HogEye Camera Setup and Tips Playlist

Quick Tips & Troubleshooting

Download HogEye App Expand

Apple Store

Google Play

Quickstart Guide Expand

View the QuickStart Guide to begin setting up your Hogeye Trap Camera.

BoarBuster Quickstart Expand

View the BoarBuster QuickStart Guide to begin setting up your BoarBuster Hogeye Trap Camera.

User Manual Expand

View the User Manual to begin setting up your Hogeye Trap Camera.

Big Pig Drop Trap User Manual Expand

View the Big Pig Drop Trap User Manual to learn more.

Frequently Asked Questions – HogEye Camera System

What kind of battery should I get?

A true 12V Marine Deep Cycle Group 29+ but here are a few we recommend. Hybrid (Dual Purpose) batteries that are commonly sold are NOT suitable for use with the HogEye camera system. Please reference the following batteries at leading retailers:

a. Walmart: Everstart Maxx Lead Acid 29DC

b. Interstate Batteries: Marine/RV Battery (DC29)

c. Interstate Batteries: SRM-31 Deep Cycle

d. NAPA: NAPA 8000 Series Battery BCI No. 31 650 A

How does the Organization work?

Each “Organization” represents the subscriber’s Group of Users. Users can be a part of multiple “Organizations.” There are 3 tiers for an organization:

• The Owner has complete control of the organization and all cameras

• An Admin can do everything EXCEPT change billing information.

• A Member can only stream the camera and download videos

How do I cut back on notifications?

If you go to the camera view screen, you will see a gear icon. If you press this, it will bring you to the camera configuration page, and you will be able to adjust the green outline, which represents the motion box. Adjust the box specifically around the area you want to monitor and click SAVE.

How many users can I have?

Currently there is No limit on the number of users in an organization.

How do I update my subscription/credit card?

Go to the online portal and log in https://signup.hogeyecameras.com Click on the “Subscription” tab and you will see the option to cancel or add a different payment method. If you add a different payment method, you will need to select it and UPDATE the subscription.

How long will a battery last?

a. A fully charged battery with no solar with last on average 5-6 days

b. A battery with solar charging will last several months at a minimum, assuming the correct battery is used and you have direct sun on the panel.

How much sunlight does my solar panel need and how to position it?

A minimum of 3 hours is required to maintain the battery at the proper charge. The more horizontal the better when positioning the solar panel.

What to do before contacting customer support.

Attempt to collect as much information as possible prior to contacting support. Camera # and e-mail address of the primary account Owner. Please make a note of which lights are on/off (Power, Signal, and Carrier).

Why is my camera “inactive”

An inactive camera doesn’t always mean it is down. An inactive camera simply means it did not check-in at the correct time. Attempt to stream the camera first to verify that it is truly not active. Inactive cameras are most often power related. Please reference the following video for more information:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zViesYJEymE&feature=youtu. be&list=PLSGLicWHpIuAiPFb4mWNMid1qKlhCkplY

How do I get in touch with customer support?

a. Phone: 855-464-3935

b. Email: support@wildlifedominion.com

c. Chat: Online chat via the HogEye App

How Does the NEW HogEye Camera System Compare to the Old?

Feature

NEW HogEye Camera

Old HogEye Camera

Size & Setup

Compact and lightweight – 75% smaller and easier to mount anywhere

Larger and heavier, requires more setup space

Battery Life

Uses less power, so batteries last longer and solar panels can be smaller

Higher power demand, needs a bigger solar system

View & Coverage

Wider field of view lets you see inside and outside the trap

Narrower view, harder to monitor the whole site

Control

Pan, tilt, and zoom features let you adjust exactly what you see

Fixed camera view

Warranty & Support

4-year warranty with U.S.-based support from real trappers

Standard warranty with limited support

Technology

Custom HogEye app designed specifically for trapping

App works, but with fewer custom features

Price

More affordable – makes HogEye accessible to more landowners

Higher price point ($2,199+), mainly for professionals

Flexibility

Works with any trap (commercial or homemade)

Best with HogEye Big Pig Drop or Panel Traps

Data Plans

Flexible plans you can start/stop anytime – no contracts or fees

Standard carrier plans with less flexibility

BUY NOW

Trusted Referrals From Your Neighbors

DeWayne Slade, Slade Hog Control LLC

“The reliability of the live video HogEye Camera with the Big Pig Drop Trap makes trapping wild, trap-shy hogs alot easier for me and my customers.”

Jody Acosta, Delta Wildlife

“I’ve used many different types of cameras assisting private landowners with trapping all across the Mississippi Delta. I can say without a doubt, HogEye is the best on the market.“

BUY NOW

Hog Traps

Big Pig Traps

Check out the Big Pig Traps that Pair Perfectly with the HogEye Camera System

With over 25 years of experience in wildlife, forestry, and natural resource management, we’ve seen firsthand the extensive damage wild hogs inflict on farms, forests, and recreational lands-costing billions. Big Pig Traps and HogEye Cameras were created from this deep knowledge, shaped by the input of landowners just like you.

Controlling wild hogs makes you a steward of the land, protecting your property and preserving the ecosystem for future generations
